dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s an unusually clear winter day as the peaks of Mount Rainier look down on the avenues and harbors of Seattle. ADAM LERNER (27) jogs through the streets of Seattle. The morning mist envelops the PIER. Adam’s iPod blares in his as he passes the FISH MARKET. Adam arrives at a street corner. Ahead, a “Don’t Walk” si blinks. So he does. Running in place, Adam looks from sid side. There’s not a car, person or thing in sight this ea in the morning. He looks again at the orange hand, urging to stop. Another JOGGER runs up behind Adam, and disobeys the crosswalk, running past him and across the street. Adam continues to wait for the light to change. The light goes green. He crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam tries to squirt shampoo into his hand, but the bottl empty. He looks over at a large assortment of women’s products, grabs the first one - Fructis by L’Oreal - and squirts some into his hair. He proceeds to lather his ent body in the product.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam dresses in front of the mirror. His outfit is well p together. He pulls out a LINT BRUSH and meticulously comb his cardigan. RACHAEL (24), wearing her oversized “KEEP T BLUE” shirt, enters the bedroom brushing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So are you staying over tonight?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Uh...Not sure. There are a couple of gallery openings I want to check out. Rachael goes through Adam's drawers looking for something RACHAEL (CONT’D) I’m so nervous about my show. I still have so much work to do. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHAEL (CONT’D) I need two more paintings and everything I’ve been coming up with is completely derivative of what I've been seeing at the Henry. (confused) Where’s my stuff?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s in your drawer.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (honored) I have a drawer?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Yeah, I just figured I'd put some of your things... there wasn’t anything in the drawer. Well there were a few things, but I just moved them to a different one because... It made sense that way.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (touched) Awwwww. Honey. We’re getting so domestic. SFX: A CAR HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle sits in his car front of Adam’s house, his seat reclined, his eyes squeezed shut, hungover. He honks the again, winces at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam rushes to gather his things.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good luck with the paintings. He moves to her, leans in - despite her mouth full of toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Oops, I’ve got toothpaste in my mouth. She wipes it off his nose. He gives her a small kiss. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHAEL (CONT’D) Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (big smile) Bye. INT. KYLE’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Adam gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yo!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. Kyle sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: ...What’s that smell? (Sniffs Adam) Did you sit in jam or something?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You smell all fruity.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. (smells himself) I ran out of shampoo. I had to use Rachael’s.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Well, you smell like you fucked the cast of “The View”. Adam looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Are we gonna go? We’re gonna be late.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: If you really care about being on time, you should probably learn how to drive.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I deserve that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know what's really going to make us late? When I stop for cappuccinos.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, no, no. We have coffee at work.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Delicious cappuccinos. Kyle drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Kyle stand in line. Kyle watches as Adam yawns repeatedly. He looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Back still hurts?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m going to see the doctor today.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Have you been fucking in weird positions?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Of course that’s where you have to go with it.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sometimes it happens when I try new positions - like I tried froggy style for a while; fucked up my back.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: “Froggy style”? I don’t even want to ask what that is.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s kind of like doggy style but you get way higher up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (beat) We haven’t done it in three weeks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (shocked) You haven’t had sex in three weeks!?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, she had a yeast infection, and then she had her period.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You can fuck on a yeast infection.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, that’s what she says.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I think that’s bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, I’ve heard that before.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Has she been sucking on your dick, giving you blow jobs?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, she doesn’t like to.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (a little upset) No fucking shit she doesn’t like to! Who likes putting dicks in their mouths? That’s why they call them jobs!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Don’t get hysterical, it’s not that big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m not hysterical. She stays at your house all the time. She leaves her fucking shit everywhere. You clean it up. You’re a nice person. The least she can do is felate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Adam walk down the sidewalk. Adam’s a few steps ahead, walking at a hurried pace as Kyle takes his time, his coffee. They Kyle INT. Adam pass

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You put up with a lot of shit when you date a hot girl. Truthfully, that’s why if you recall in high school I didn’t date any hot girls.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s why?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yes. That’s why.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, we’re not in high school anymore. The relationship I have with Rachael is about more than sex.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (condescending) What is it about, Adam?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We care about each other -- talk to each other.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be nice if you could do that and bang the hell out of each other afterwards? walk up the front steps of SEATTLE PUBLIC RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Ideally, yes. But it’s not a perfect world, OK?...Can you hurry up please? stops and leans over.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Ugh...Just got to tie my shoe.

dialogues.speaker: SEATTLE PUBLIC RADIO
dialogues.text: and Kyle enter the offices of Seattle Public Radio. They JENNY at the reception desk. Kyle shoots her a smile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Morning Jenny. She ignores him. As they continue, Seth looks over at Ada nervously biting on his finger nails.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s so gross man. You shouldn’t do that. PHIL (40), Adam and Kyle’s boss, passes by.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Kyle...Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey Phil.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (worried) Sorry we're late. Phil looks at his watch, not even aware of the time.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Huh. Look at that, you are late. Don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Listen, I wanted to talk to you about the volcano piece, it’s coming along really well, I’ve done all the research and interviews-

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah but the narration is turning into a bit of a problem. Whoever did it, he kept clearing his throat and he didn’t pause, he just kept talking - there aren’t any edit points. If he had just stopped and cleared his throat I could cut around it, but he didn’t-- Phil’s cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, grab that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pulls out his Blackberry and walks off, ignoring the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: OK. I’m just going to-- Adam and Kyle watch Phil walk away. Adam turns to Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It's like he doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s like we got to put shit on the air. And it’s pointless to spend months working on something that someone’s going to hear for two seconds stopped at a red light.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I like it when my work is good.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Good luck with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits at his desk, head phones on, editing his volcan story on Pro-Tools. He meticulously edits the same audio point over and over. He cringes at the deafening sound of Kyle’s laughter across the office.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (into phone) You're in Wales? So does that make you Welsh? Or Wale-ish? Adam looks at Kyle in annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: OK. World Music...Can you hear me? You sound like a robot...Does it sound weird to you? It sounds weird to me...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You have to be quieter, I’m-- Kyle is oblivious to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I said you sound like a robot... Wait, wait, wait. Go back. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE (cont'd) It’s unbelievable. I know. I don’t know what ‘World Music’ is either! Annoyed, Adam imitates Kyle to himself.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (as Kyle) I’m such a fucking asshole. I’m the king of the world, suck my dick. I hear Adam hasn’t gotten his dick sucked in six fucking months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam steps off a BUS and walks toward the hospital’s vast sunlit entryway. He enters through the sliding double doo eventually disappearing into the din of the crowd. INT. DR. ROSS’ OFFICE - LATER Adam leafs through a pamphlet on incontinence when the pedantic DR. ROSS enters.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: (curt) Hi. Dr. Ross looks over Adam’s chart, examines his MRI scans, pulls out a DICTAPHONE -

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: (into the dictaphone) Patient has been complaining of back pain, and night sweats. Blood tests and urine analysis are normal. MRI suggests a massive intradural malignant schwannoma neurofibrosarcoma extending into psoas muscle with nerve root compression syndrome and bone erosion. We see Adam’s face gradually look more and more confused. slowly begins to raise his arm as if to ask a question.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Growth extends from the L2 to L5. Will send patient for biopsy to confirm. Dr. Ross turns to see Adam holding his arm in the air. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I didn’t follow that. Is there something wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: (points to MRI) If you look here on your MRI, you see this cephalopod-like object spreading down along your spinal column? Adam squints. It all looks the same. DR. ROSS (CONT’D) That is a massive schwannoma neurofibrosarcoma.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I still don’t--

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: It’s a malignant tumor.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: A tumor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That doesn’t make sense...I don’t smoke. I don’t drink. I recycle...

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Well your case it’s actually quite fascinating. Your cancer is the result of an incredibly rare gene mutation in chromosome 17p in the p53 gene that causes the growth of malignant cells in tissue around the nerves. In your case it’s grown along the nerves in your lower spine. Adam walks over to the window and peers out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: People can go years without knowing they’re sick. We’re lucky we caught it before it metastasizes. Given the placement and size of your particular tumor, the wisest course of action is to see if we can possibly reduce this thing down to a more managable size. (Beat) I’m going to put you on a four month regimen of chemotherapy. (beat) Now Chemotherapy can result in fertility issues--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But I’m going to be okay? Dr. Ross puts on his best act of reassurance. His words a seemingly genuine; his tone is anything but.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you need to talk to someone... We have an excellent staff of social workers and psychologists here in the hospital. They specialize in cases...in these...sort of matters. They’1ll be able to help you. Dr. Ross continues to talk as Adam looks out of the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a computer screen: “Neurofibromasarcoma Schwannoma is a malignant or cancero form of Schwanoma. Treatment Forms: Chemotherapy and Radiation. Surgical resection proven to be most effective. Risks of surgery: Amputation of limbs. Paralysis. Death. It is a rare tumor type, with a relatively poor prognosis Patient response to treatment will vary based on age, hea and the tolerance to medications and therapies. 5 Year survival rate: 50%. 5 year survival rate after metastasis: 0%.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the screen. This is not good. Everyone else leaving for the day, shutting off lights. Adam stays, immobile and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits deep in thought - or in shock - hard to tell. T dusky pink sky of Seattle streaks by through tinted glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Rachael are on the couch, her eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh Adam...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Listen. I don’t expect you to take this on. It’s not like we’re married or anything. If you have to bail, bail. (off her look) I hope you won’t--I mean, I want you with me. But if you have to-- She looks at him, into his eyes, closes hers:

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I’m not going to bail on you, Adam. She leans over, hugs him. RACHAEL (CONT’D) I’m here for you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Thank you. Rachael rubs Adam’s back.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. Rachael leans in and puts her forehead against Adam's.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Kyle stand outside the coffee shop. Kyle looks s

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Don’t throw up -- you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I actually think I’m going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're not going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Just open your eyes...Look at me. Alright? They both take a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What kind of cancer is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s something rare.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Well, what’s it called?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Schwanoma something...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (confused) Schwanoma?...What’s Schwanoma?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That means tumor basically.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Do you have a picture of it, can I see it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why would I have a picture of it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s common practice to fucking get pictures of shit now!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like anything, it’s just a lump.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Well are you going to be okay? What are your odds?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I looked it up and it said 50/50, but that’s the internet SO... Kyle sighs in relief.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (upbeat ) That’s not that bad. That’s better than I thought. You’re going to be fine. You’re young...People beat cancer all the time. Every celebrity beats cancer. Lance Armstrong, he keeps getting it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: The guy from “Dexter”? He’s OK. Patrick Swayze; he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Patrick Swayze?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: And he’s older.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But dude, that guy’s dead. Kyle looks at Adam in shock.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s really fucked up. I didn’t know that. (beat) Don’t even think about him...Don’t worry about that. You got to look at the bright side here--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: The bright side of what?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. Kyle quickly tries to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What did your parents say? Did they freak out?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, I...they...I’m not going to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell them? You've got to tell them. Your mom’11 probably deal with it better than most people...Your dad has Alzheimer's.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you know how she gets.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You have to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (concedes ) I know. I’1l tell her. Kyle takes another deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You'll be fine. 50/50! If you were a casino game you’d have the best odds! Kyle pats Adam’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Good talk. Kyle begins walking away from the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You don’t want coffee?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m awake now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam’s mother, DIANE LERNER (58), steps out of her car an onto the curb where she’s greeted by her son.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hi Mom.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Hi Honey! She gives Adam a big hug and kiss. Based on his body language, it’s clear Diane’s very existence annoys the sh out of Adam. RICHARD LERNER (60) wanders out from behind Diane. On fir glance he seems like a perfectly normal middle aged man, on closer examination it’s clear that Alzheimer's has alt his sense of reality. He extends his hand to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hi Dad.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Richard.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (to Richard) This is Adam -- your son. Remember? Adam shakes his dad’s hand and gives him an awkward pat o the shoulder. It’s clear Richard makes Adam uncomfortable

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Adam... Meanwhile, Rachael stands on the porch, awkward smile plastered on her face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: , (from porch) Hil (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane politely nods and waves in her direction as she and Adam walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: So what's the big news?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s nothing...I’1l1 tell you inside.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s not pregnant? Adam stops, turns and looks at his mother.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I know, I know, you use protection. Adam cringes, totally mortified. He stares at her for a b then turns and walks into the house, shaking his head. As Diane follows behind she notices the paint on Adam’s p is chipping.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to talk to your landlord about painting this.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Adam rolls his eyes and walks:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Diane follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just give me his number and I'll call him. Diane notices an ABSTRACT PAINTING hanging on the wall ab the TV.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: That’s new.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Rachael made it for me...It’s called “Oppression”. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachael leans over and corrects him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: “Liberation”.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s right! That one’s “Liberation”. “Oppression” is in the bathroom. Diane feigns a smile, trying to seem impressed.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Rachael, Diane, and Richard sit at the dinner table eating pizza. Diane hands Richard a fistfull of pills. Richard takes the pills, puts them in his mouth and swall He smiles...Diane scans the house.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: So, what's the special occasion? Adam hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something. But, before I do, you have to promise me you’re going to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh Adam, don’t be so overdramatic.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Mom, just promise me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I promise...You make me out to be some kind of irrational loon.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen “Terms of Endearment”?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, Adam...Just tell her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Tell me what? Here goes nothing. Adam nods.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (mumbles ) I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: What do you mean, “I have cancer”?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have cancer. What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (reluctant) I found out a few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: A few days ago?! You waited a few days to tell me?!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Honey. Diane's face literally crumples. She tries to compose herself.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (beat) I’m moving in.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What? No. Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I’m your mother Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You already have enough on your plate with dad.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Who's going to take care of you? You can't even drive! Who's going to take you to your appointments? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks over at Rachel, who notices.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Me. I will. I’m going to take care of him. Diane sits motionless for what seems like an eternity. Th only indication that she’s not dead is the movement of he index finger, which twitches uncontrollably. Adam sits uneasy, trying to anticipate his mother’s next move.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom? Diane calmly rises from her seat and heads to the:

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Adam follows after her:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom, what are you doing? Diane lights the stove, puts up a kettle:

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I’m making you green tea.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Please, will you come sit down? Diane holds up the package of Green Tea.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I saw on “The Today Show” that it reduces your risk of getting cancer by fifteen percent.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well -- I already have cancer. Adam puts his arm on his mother’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Please come back to the table. Diane hugs him and begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks down the corridor and stops at a reception des (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m looking for Dr. McKay? THE ATTENDANT silently points to an office a few doors do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is a pit of chaos; small with stacks of psycho books and files strewn about. An attractive young woman, KATHERINE (24), sits on the couch reading a file while sh eats a rather messy sandwich. She, like her office, is scattered in appearance. She takes a bite of her sandwich Adam pokes his head in the door. She looks up-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have an appointment with Dr. McKay.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh... please come in... Katherine removes her files from the couch, while awkward balancing her sandwich on top. She rises and puts her han out to shake Adam’s - he reluctantly shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: .--and please, call me Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (confused) You're Dr. McKay?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I am. Have a sit. (corrects herself) Sit down please. Katherine wraps up her sandwich and puts the rest away. A looks her up and down.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Aren’t you supposed to be like sixty-five and wear earth-toned sweaters?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (slightly defensive) Why? Did someone say that’s what I look like? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. But, if you don’t mind...How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (put off) Twenty-four.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Twenty-four? What are you like Doogie Howser?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Doogie Howser... Off Katherine’s blank look.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...The teenage doctor.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Does he work here?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. Nevermind...but aren’t you too young to be a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (almost laughing) Oh, technically I’m not a doctor yet. I wish. I’m actually working on my doctorate. (off Adam's look, trying to be serious) This is a training hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I see...So have you had many patients?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: My patient history is not--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (shocked) I'm your first patient, aren’t I?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Your second?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Third. Katie looks at him in silent acceptance. Adam’s eyes wide with concern:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How are the first two doing? Katherine doesn’t answer. She bites her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Can’t talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: And this is like part of your training?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It'll be part of my dissertation. But, don’t worry I’m not gonna use your real name.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Okay. I guess that’s fine. An awkward beat. Katherine pulls Adam's file:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So, Dr. Ross filled me in on your situation. This must be incredibly difficult. Adam shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You know, honestly, I feel fine. I’ve actually never been more calm.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (proud of herself) That’s a very common symptom found in patients like yourself. Right now your body is in survival mode. What you’re actually experiencing is shock... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, I think I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: ...That’s why you feel that sense of calm. Would you describe what you're feeling as a kind of “numbness”?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I would describe it as fine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Because certain patients--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (defiant) I feel great. Katherine bites her tongue. Adam nods,

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Wonderful, I think that’s wonderful -- if it’s alright with you, today I'd like to start with some very simple relaxation exercises. tense.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But I am relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I know you are. But if you want to lie down...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Lie down?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Adam clearly doesn’t trust her, but lies down. Katherine presses play on her laptop - playing new agey meditation music.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: And close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Really? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, for this to work, you’re gonna have to trust me. Adam closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: They’re closed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No peeking...Keep your eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is in the living room with his eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: OK. Open your eyes. Adam opens his eyes to see Rachael standing next to a ver old and giant GREYHOUND. The dog stands motionless. RACHAEL (CONT’D) Surprise! Adam’s excitement quickly dissipates.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: His name is Skeletor. He’s a retired race dog.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You got me an old dog?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: He’s not that old.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, he’s old enough to be retired. The dog continues to stand motionless.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Having a dog helps with the healing process. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why, does he have a medical license?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Forget it. I can bring him back to the shelter in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well what’s going to happen to him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: He'll be put back in his tiny cage with ten other dogs who will bully, and rape him, until he’s eventually euthanized. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Fine, I’1ll keep the dog.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Really? Rachael's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: This is going to be so good for you, I promise. Adam grumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Adam’s going away party. Draped across the entrance “Bon Voyage” banner with an image of a Cruise Ship. Jenny stands to the side crying as Kyle consoles her.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This whole party was my idea. Thought maybe we could just celebrate his life.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: He’s going to get better, right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I hope so. But, tonight I thought it’d be best if we didn’t think about whether he gets better or not. We should be celebrating the Adam we all know and love. Kyle steals a quick glimpse of Jenny’s cleavage. Adam stands in the middle of the party with JOE.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Started chemo yet? Adam stands with TED.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: So what kind of cancer you Adam stands with SUSAN.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Want to know the secret to this thing? Adam stands with GREG.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: My uncle had what you got.. Kyle's with Jenny who’s still crying. her arm.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I liked to be touched when Phil embraces Adam.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: (sentimental) I’m gonna miss you so much. cur cur got? cur beating cur

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK
dialogues.text: After a beat, he Iocry. cur

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: rubs

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) I’m going to miss you too Phil. Phil leans his head on Adam’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey, Phil--?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I want you to know, I’m still going to finish that Mount Moha Moha story.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Take as much time as you need...I can’t wait to hear it. Phil continues to hold Adam. INT. RACHAEL’S CAR - DAY Rachael’s Prius, which is covered in various Save-the-Wor type bumper stickers, is parked in front of the hospital. Adam turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say that you’ve been really great the past couple of weeks. Thanks for the ride. And breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Thanks for saying that. Adam opens the passenger side door, and as he gets out, Rachael yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam. He turns back and sticks his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You coming? She shakes her head hesitantly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: If it’s cool, I'll just wait here.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s going to take four hours.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You’re gonna sit here for four hours?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Honey, I don’t want to mix that world and this world. It’s like an energy thing, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (confused) Right. She gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Good luck! Rachael watches Adam as he walks off into the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of patients, including Adam, sit in the wai room. GEORGE, a tall male nurse of Bahamian descent, calls out-

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Adam Lerner. Adam stands.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yep. Adam follows George into the: INT. ELEVATOR —- CONTINUOUS The doors slowly close as they ride down into the bowel o the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking through the long ominous halls of the hospital basement, Adam passes dozens of sick patients who are bei shuttled into Radiation Therapy, Chemotherapy and other various treatment rooms. A sick, fat, bald elderly woman coughs as she passes. Adam winces in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This way my baby. George leads Adam into a Chemotherapy Treatment room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is seated in a plush leather chair where he’s hooked into a chemo drip. He's surrounded by three other patient An 74 YEAR OLD MAN, who munches on macaroons, a MIDDLE AG BALD MAN, and a BALD WOMAN, who knits as she listens to m on her headphones, a Zen look on her face. ALAN (84), sitting next Adam, whispers to him:

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (to Adam) Want a macaroon?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Thanks. I’m alright. Adam looks down to see that Alan is holding box of macaro

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) There’s weed in ‘em. Adam looks to the middle aged man, MITCH (55), who smiles Adam as he pops a macaroon in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don’t do weed.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: C’mon. Just get high with us! Adam reluctantly eats a macaroon. Mitch leans over, stone hell.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Twenty-seven. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: That's just the worst? A perfectly good youth wasted.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Alan, stop it. Don’t listen to him, he's just messing with you.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (To Adam) Listen to me, this cancer is bull shit. First your hair’s going to fall out, then your balls’11 shrink. And if that isn’t enough, your dick becomes a constant source of disappointment. Alan and Mitch laugh like two teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I got to tell you, I was really nervous about this whole cancer thing, and then I met you guys, and boy do I feel better. Alan and Mitch laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (to Adam) I’m Alan Lombardo: stage 3 lymphoma. Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Mitch Barnett, metastatic prostate cancer.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m Adam Lerner, schwannoma neurofibrosarcoma.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Tough break. The more syllables, the worse it is. Alan and Mitch laugh. Adam pops another macaroon in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: These are really good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thanks, my wife made ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (chewing) ...-how strong are they?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Stroooong. Adam sits back and closes his eyes. Upbeat music swells..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks in SLOW MOTION down the same ominous corridor entered through before. Only it’s no longer ominous to hi He wears a big huge goofy smirk on his face as he passes: --a SICK MAN on a gurney --an OLD LADY wheezing --a BODY BAG being carted on a gurney --a FAMILY crying Adam stops, stares at all the misery around and laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam jolts out of bed. His clothes are drenched in sweat. quickly runs into the bathroom and throws up. A lot. Rachael wakes up, and knows she should go to him, but can Instead, she faintly calls out-

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam, you okay? Adam says nothing, he just slumps over the toilet seat an throws up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks and feels terrible. His head pounds, causing h to rub it. Katherine sits in the chair next to him. Her t is a little rigid - masking her lack of experience.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So how are you feeling after your first treatment? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It feels pretty bad, gotta say. My head is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (empathetic) Yeah I know. From what I understand it can be pretty rough. But it will pass. She pats Adam on the arm. Her intention is to set Adam at ease, but the act just makes him more uncomfortable. Startled, he backs away.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Uh...huh.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I think it’s important to remember that these side effects are very normal.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Good. I’d hate to think I was special in any way.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (nervous ) That’s not what I meant. I was just trying to reassure you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (terse) Well, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m sensing some anger. Which is good.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m not angry. (beat) Why is that good?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Because you're expressing yourself. You're dealing with a really serious illness. That brings up a lot of emotions.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're trying to make me freak out, right? That’s the goal here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m not trying to make you freak out. I just want you to get in touch with what’s going on inside. And if you’re angry--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (angry) I’m not angry...Let’s do the relaxation thing... Can we do that? I want to hear some sitars. Go to my happy place and feel the warm of beam of light. Can we do that? Katherine’s a little shaken by Adam’s outburst. He feels although that outburst did feel kind of good.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm sorry...I was being an asshole. I didn’t mean to say that. Katherine regains her footing. Adam nods,

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don’t need you to take care of me. (smiles) I’m trying to take care of you. hesitant. Katherine exhales and scribbles on a piece of paper:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, there’s a few books I’d like you to read. A lot of people find them really helpful. You don’t have to read them cover-to-cover. Just take a look to see if they resonate. She pats her hand on Adam’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, are you going to keep touching me like that?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What? This? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine puts her hand back on Adam’s shoulder. Adam pul away.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. That.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I'm trying to help you feel more at ease. Adam imitates Katherine’s touching.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s supposed to make me feel more at ease? It’s like being slapped by a sea otter.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Touching promotes trust. It’s one of the key ways that hospital practitioners can help patients feel more secure in stressful situations.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That's, um, it’s not -- comforting. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Really, sea otter? Is this better? Katherine tries again. This time it’s too gentle.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Now it’s just getting creepy. INT. ADAM'S BATHROOM -— DAY Adam stands in front of the mirror. Kyle stands behind hi tying a towel around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I think you’re making a big, big mistake. Please don’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What if you have some weird Gorbachev bird shit thing on your head? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I thought you liked this idea?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I liked the idea in theory. Now that we’re standing here about to do it, I’m a little worried you're going to look like fucking Michael Stipe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to do it!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You said you would!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I changed my mind - because if it looks bad, you’1ll blame me every time you see your weird screwed up bald head. Adam grabs the PAIR OF CLIPPERS and goes in for the shave pauses.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Wait...what do you use this for? Adam's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know, my body.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: When was the last time you cleaned it? Kyle wipes the clippers on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Right now. Adam takes the clippers and proceeds to shave his head. K covers his eyes in horror.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fuck! Dude! Holy Shit! After a beat, Kyle grabs the trimmers and joins in. Once finished, Adam looks at his bald head in the mirror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It looks okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No. It looks really weird.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why didn’t we go to a barber?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That would have been a much better idea -- if we had paid someone to do it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Instead of using your balls trimmer-

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: And I never wash them, ever. And it’s not my balls, it’s my asshole....I’m joking...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're not joking.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Alan and Mitch sit in their chairs, attached to the CHEMO DRIPS. Adam looks SLIGHTLY WORN.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How come we've never met Rachael?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hospitals kind of freak her out. Alan and Mitch look at each other and groan.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (being delicate) Well Adam, no one likes going to the hospital. That’s not why people go-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, you don’t get it. She doesn’t want the negative mixing with the positive...it’s an energy thing.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Sounds to me like a bullshit thing. Adam takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You guys can meet her after. She’s picking me up. I’m sure she’d like to meet you all...She’s really great, you guys.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (not convinced) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, standing next to Mitch and Alan, is on his cell pho

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey it’s me again, just checking to see if you’re close...Talk to you soon. He hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Sure you don’t need a ride, kid?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh no, she’s gonna come. I’m sure she’s just caught up with something. You guys should head out, you can meet her next time.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Alan and Mitch give him a sympathetic look at Adam and th walk off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam’s seated on the steps out front. He looks exhausted. Rachael’s Prius speeds into the parking lot and stops in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam! I know. don’t be mad. I’m sorry. Please you fucked

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’ve been calling you for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: My cell phone died.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do this, know.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (remorseful) I’m sorry. I am. I know, I up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I even gave you an out.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I’m doing my best...Can we home? just go Adam gets in the car, pissed, and they drive off. INT. BOOKSTORE.

dialogues.speaker: SELF HELP SECTION
dialogues.text: Adam and Kyle browse through shelves of books. Adam consu Katherine’s list of books. Kyle grabs the book, and rathe then hand it to Adam, he reads the AUTHOR’S BIO on the ba jacket of the book.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (in excitement) “Kasper Schlegel is an American ‘medical intuitive’ and ‘mystic psychiatrist’”. ‘Mystic psychiatrist’? What is he like Frodo’s psychiatrist? Why would you buy that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Because my therapist said I should - (shrugs ) I don’t know. Kyle ditches the book and picks up one on Mardi Gras.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go to Mardi Gras!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have a girlfriend, why would I go to Mardi Gras?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, your girlfriend, I forgot. Why go to Mardi Gras when you could be here, not getting hand jobs and blow jobs? From across the store, Kyle notices CLAIRE (30), an attractive employee stacking books.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Well if you’re not going to take advantage of this, then I am. Kyle yanks the list of books from Adam and crosses to Cla He throws on a charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi- Noticing Claire’s name tag.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Claire. Kyle. Could you help me find a few books, please?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sure. Kyle hands Claire the list of book titles. She reads.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh. (Concerned) Are these for you?...I’m sorry it’s none of my business. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, thank God. Actually, they’re for my friend. The little guy in the hat. Kyle nods towards Adam across the room.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He’s my buddy, he’s really, really sick. Claire shoots Adam a look - the way one looks at a dying puppy. Adam looks on in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: How awful.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. He has ‘Type Four Back Cancer’ - not cool.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Poor guy.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I know. It’s been really hard. (Feigning sadness) But I don’t focus on that, I focus on the positive, by taking him out to book stores. I like to take him for walks. Plays. While he has time.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s so nice of you. Claire leads Kyle off to a stack of books.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BOOKSTORE
dialogues.text: As Adam and Kyle exit the bookstore, they pass Claire.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Claire) I'll see you tonight. Then as they exit, and walk along the sidewalk, Kyle can’ help but boast of his achievement; rubbing it in Adam’s f

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Claire! Nice to meet you, Claire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam’s lying on the couch with a cold washcloth on his he watching TV. The phone rings. He snatches it, checks call ID: “Mom”. He presses “Ignore”. He checks his RECENT CALL The screen reads “Mom. Mom. Mom. Mom. Mom.” On cue, his l line rings. Frustrated, he answers.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What, Mom? DIANE’S VOICE Jesus, what took so long to pick up? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I didn’t hear the phone ring. DIANE’S VOICE Do you need anything? I was about to go to the Rite-Aid for your father...You want me to come over? I can bring dinner. I can make macaroni and cheese.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Mom, I haven’t liked macaroni and cheese since I was like ten. (softens) It’s all right, Rachael’s going to come over later. DIANE’S VOICE You sure?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m totally fine... In WIDE SHOT, Adam sits alone in his house. Seemingly not fine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: ...Don’t worry so much.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: All right. If you say so. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hip gallery opening. Kyle and Claire have drinks and st at awful art.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This one is really cool!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (beat) My friend did this, actually.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (laughs ) No way! Your friend is a real talent. Claire moves on to another piece.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So what do you think of this one? Kyle turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Uh oh! I think I have a new favorite!...This is genius...It’s making me a little emotional. Just then Kyle sees Rachael across the crowded room.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, I should have known I’d see her. We’re at a fucking gallery opening.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know my best friend, the one who's sick? That’s his pretentious girlfriend. They follow Rachael as she walks up to a WHITE GUY WITH DREADLOCKS and flirts with him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: She doesn’t look like someone’s girlfriend. Just then Rachael gives the guy a passionate, deep kiss. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Fuck! I knew it! The kiss goes on long enough for Kyle to take out his cel phone and snap a picture.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) I nailed that cunt! (to Claire) Can you believe it?! Claire walks away, disgusted. Kyle quickly follows after

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Sorry - I - uh, don’t usually use words like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is asleep on the couch when he hears Rachael come in

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sleepy) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (reaching for her) Come here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m so tired. Can we just get into bed? She holds out a hand to help him up just as Kyle opens th front door.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Hey! Surprise! It’s Kyle! What’s happening, guys? He couldn’t be in a better mood.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (confused) Hey Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--bad time? Am I interrupting something? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well it’s midni-

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was in the neighborhood. I had a date with Claire, the bookstore girl. It did not go well, due to a lack of chemistry and I think an overuse of profanity on my part. But, whilst on my date, I ran into - Rachael.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Kyle pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would like to present... Kyle holds the phone to Adam’s face.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Exhibit...whore! On the camera screen is a very grainy picture of Rachael kissing the guy at the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look! Look at it!!! That’s Rachael! And that’s a fucking dirty Jesus looking motherfucker, and they’re kissing! I did it! (to Rachael) I FUCKING NAILED YOU!!! I’ve hated you for months! And now I have evidence that you suck as a person! Kyle looks at Adam and Rachael’s silent faces.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Nothing? (beat) You two should probably talk about this... He steps into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're cheating on me!?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: No! I mean - yes but- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (coming apart) Adam - you have no idea how hard it’s been! I don’t know how to do this, and it’s been so stressful, and you've been so sick, and shit, you're the one who told me Kyle keeps using your cancer to get girls! Why should I be the bad guy?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because you’re his girlfriend, and you cheated on him while he has cancer, you fucking lunatic!

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (ignoring Kyle) Adam. We had problems long before you got sick. And then when you got sick, I didn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So why are you here? Why do you spend every night in my bed?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don’t know. I didn’t want to abandon you. (beat) Let’s go to bed, we can talk about this tomorrow. Speechless, Adam sits on the couch: humiliated, heartbrok ruined. Kyle re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I can’t stay in the kitchen any longer. (to Rachael) You got to get out of here! You’re making this way too uncomfortable for everyone. Just leave! Kyle leads her to the door. She resists.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam, we'll talk tomorrow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No you won’t! Why would you talk tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam, I care about you...Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You are reprehensible!

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (to Kyle) Will you shut up?! (to Adam) Kyle doesn’t have your best interest in mind.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I don’t? Cause I’m pretty sure I’m not the one who got caught making out with some disgusting hippie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You're disgusting! Rachael slams the door and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lies in bed. He looks over at Rachael’s empty spot. inhales, feeling very alone. Just then Skeletor jumps up and lies down next to him, practically upending the bed. Adam looks at him, pets him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Kyle are out walking Skeletor.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This is the best thing that could have happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You deserve better, way better. If I was your girlfriend, I’d be baking you cookies and blowing you every thirty minutes...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What kind of cookies?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Any kind.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Would you make me Snickerdoodle cookies?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'd bathe you in Snickerdoodle.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: This conversation is making me nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Actually?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, that was a joke. an attractive girl, BODI, walking a dog approaches

dialogues.speaker: BODI
dialogues.text: Hi! What’s his name?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Skeletor.

dialogues.speaker: BODI
dialogues.text: This is Marlowe.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Why hello Marlowe!

dialogues.speaker: BODI
dialogues.text: You guys live around here?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: We sure do. Bodi bends over and pets Skeletor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BODI
dialogues.text: I love greyhounds. (to Skeletor) Hellllooo. You’re a good ol’ boy. Nervous, Adam suddenly gets very protective of Skeletor.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We should go, he doesn’t like the cold. (to Bodi) Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: BODI
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you! Adam pulls Skeletor away. The girl continues on her way.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You could’ve fucked that girl, you realize that, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No one wants to have sex with me. Look at me - I look like Voldemort.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You could’ve asked her to go ona doggie date, whipped out the cancer card, fuck the shit out of her! Adam thinks-

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You really think a girl’s gonna go for me just because I have cancer?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I know it. Help me, help you get laid.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You think that would work?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It would totally work! Adam thinks more.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Let’s do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is loud and packed with Seattle hipsters. With no room to move, Adam and Kyle stand pressed against the bar counter. The room is hot and Adam’s knit hat is causing h to sweat uncontrollably. Adam scans the crowd - this is definitely not his scene. A very ATTRACTIVE WOMAN leans i the bar.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Lot's of hot girls. Good odds tonight. Ok, over there, blue shirt? Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Just talk, spark up a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ATTRACTIVE WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) One PBR. Adam leans over to the woman, yelling above the music:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How’s it going? The woman doesn’t even look at him. Kyle leans in.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Get into the cancer thing faster.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Faster?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s your hook man.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So that’s the first thing I say? ‘Hello, I have cancer.’

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s what sets you apart. You’re sympathetic. Just try it.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: ATTRACTIVE WOMAN #2 (30) squeezes in next to him. She drunkenly bobs her head to the song as she orders a drink (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam reluctantly looks over at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to the woman) I love this song.

dialogues.speaker: ATTRACTIVE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have cancer. Kyle pulls Adam away as the girl looks on, weirded out.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I was wrong, I was wrong. Doesn’t work like that. It doesn’t sound cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle’s talking to two girls in their mid twenties, ALLISO and JACKIE. Adam stands alone in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I'm Kyle, how’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Allison.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Jackie. Kyle shakes their hands.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Allison, Jackie. It’s my birthday today.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Happy birthday! The girls raise their beers and toast Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Cheers!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m here with my buddy actually. Kyle points out Adam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: The skinny one?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: One second. Kyle rushes over to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I met two girls over there.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Are they nice?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: They are, very nice.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Let’s talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Take the hat off.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Take it off, take it off.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m not taking it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar’s less crowded now. Kyle and Adam are seated in a booth across from Allison and Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What do you all do?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I just designed the website for the Swiffer--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (excited) Are you serious? Sorry, I'ma fan. I love the Swiffer! I use it for everything. Sweeping, mopping -- well that’s it really, so not everything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls looks bored. Adam looks at Kyle out of the corn of his eye-

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (mouths ) Do it. Adam shakes him off.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I just got a dog and he’s always shedding, and with the Swiffer all I have to do is attach the wet cloth and boom, I’m done.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Oh, I love dogs. What’s his name?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Skeletor. Adam looks back at Kyle then reluctantly pulls off his ha revealing his bald head.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s kind of warm in here, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: (stunned) Oh wow -- you’re bald.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh no, it’s just cancer.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Cancer?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But don't worry, I’m not contagious.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, what kind of cancer is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Spinal.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s in his spine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Spinal? I didn’t even know that was possible. How'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don't know, bad mattress? She laughs. Adam and Kyle look at each other. They're in.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He still has a sense of humor! It’s inspirational!

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Can I touch it? Is that weird?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You can do more than touch it! The girls rub Adam's bald head.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: This is a very nice head.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Let’s rub it together. Kyle reaches out, also rubbing Adam’s head.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You know, it’1l grow back if you rub it enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam slumps against a building, as the Jackie and Allison now clearly drunk, order food. Kyle approaches.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: How you doing? You OK?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Please let me go to sleep. All I want is sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No! Do not close your eyes. You've got to keep going! All we have to do is stay awake until they decide to go to sleep, because if we’re there when they do, sex will happen. (beat) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE (cont'd) We're so close... Don’t waste my time, man! Adam's eyes flutter.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m so tired. Can you give me an approximate time I‘1l be having sex?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: In ninety-five minutes...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I can’t wait that long.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s how long it’1l take! The girls return with two jumbo hot dogs:

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You guys want to hit up Lush? I know the DJ--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I think I’m actually done for the night. I’m pretty exhausted. (feigning) The chemo really wears you out. Jackie looks at him, disappointed. Kyle is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (beat) But, I have some really potent medical weed if you want to come over.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: That sounds cool.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Great idea! Let’s get a cab! Psyched beyond belief, Kyle nudges Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Adam) That was pimp! Very impressive. Adam smiles at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie and Adam lie in bed. She’s on top of him, eyes clo SCREWING HIS BRAINS OUT. Adam looks miserable. With each thrust, he winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Am I hurting you?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Actually, yeah. It does--

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'll just get off you. Jackie rolls off him. They lie next to each other awkward

dialogues.speaker: INT. ADAM'S KITCHEN- DAWN
dialogues.text: In the rising light of dawn, Adam, in boxers and t-shirt, pours himself some water from a Brita. He puts it back in fridge. He turns, enters the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Allison lie on the couch, both naked under a blanket, watching a gratuitously violent film on TV.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I wonder what the machine gun budget on this film was.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Can we watch something else?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, I want to see how it ends. Adam stands in the doorway. Kyle locks eyes with him. Ada not happy or sad - just lost. Kyle forces a smile. Adam shrugs and walks back into the bedroom. MONTAGE VARIOUS DOCTOR’S APPOINTMENT --CU of a light being shone in Adam's face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CU of a doctor’s hands pressed against Adam’s lymph nod --CU of a tongue depressor probing Adam’s mouth. --CU as a nurse slides the weight along a scale. --CU of blood being drawn from Adam's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine walks to her car. She notices Adam sitting alon the BUS STOP.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh hey.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Waiting for the bus.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (beat) I’m on my way home right now - want a ride?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m used to the bus, but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I can’t let you take the bus.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I live kind of far away.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Won’t take no for an answer. INT. KATHERINE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER (DAY) Adam is seated in the front seat as Katherine drives. The is filthy - it’s littered with papers, magazines, food wrappers, etc. Katherine’s body is pressed all the way up against the steering wheel with her eyes fixed on the roa (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Sorry about the mess. I’m not very good at getting rid of things.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Let me know if you need me to pull over...I know that the chemotherapy can make you...you know...nauseous. Silent beat as they both stare out the windshield, unsure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So, you don’t have a car?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. Don’t even have a license.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s incredibly dangerous. (beat) It’s the fifth leading cause of death. Only a couple after cancer.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Still. The bus. The bus after chemo.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachael usually drives me -- but we broke up.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What? When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: A few days ago. She kind of cheated on me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh. Adam. Do you want to talk about it? Adam’s about to answer when...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. Nuh-uh. No therapy. You are giving me this ride as a friend. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (looking around) You know what we could talk about? All of this mess. Are you aware of the bacteria that’s probably living in here?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam, your girlfriend cheated on you-- (beat) I know what’s it’s like. Break ups suck, I just broke up with someone a few months ago.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s fine. I ended it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How long were you two together?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Three months -- (uncomfortable) And we shouldn’t be talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why not? You know every thing about me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I just don’t think it’s appropriate for me to be telling you all this personal stuff. The whole therapist/patient relationship doesn’t work if you know all my problems. She smiles, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Admittedly, I do check his Facebook page everyday to see if he’s dating someone new. So pathetic-— (beat) Probably shouldn't have said that. We can just listen to the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam thinks for a beat. Then looks at the floor, looks at pile of garbage at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (abrupt) Stop the car. Katherine looks at Adam nervously.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why? What’s wrong? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Just stop the car. Katherine stops the car. Adam grabs a handful and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I can’t handle all this mess.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Are you serious? of her garbage Adam tosses the garbage in a dumpster and comes back to t car for more. Katherine laughs as she gets out and joins

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Wait, no, not that. That’s my dinner.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: This. Katherine grabs a food container from Adam’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're going to eat that?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Don’t judge me. They leave Katherine’s dinner behind, then throw out the of the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Katherine arrive at Adam's house.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, this is me. Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No problem. Thanks for cleaning my car. Adam looks at his house. The lights are out. He’s really in the mood to be alone. He gives out a deep sigh and the gets out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ll see you next week.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You'll be all right? By yourself?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Totally. I’m fine. He gets out of the car and walks away. Katherine looks af him, with concern. She rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Hey-- Adam turns around.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to have my cell number. Call me if you ever need anything. Katherine scribbles her cell phone on a piece of hands it to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (teasing) Did I just score your digits? Katherine turns red.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) No.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That was a joke. paper and (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (awkward) That’s fine. Jokes make for a good coping mechanism...This is only for emergencies. (beat) Or if you need someone to talk to...Good night.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Adam and Kyle smoke a mini-bong bubbler as they watch “Pl Earth” on a brand new 50” flat screen TV. Skeletor is asl on the floor. There’s a

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I thought the desert was crazy. The ocean’s fucking nuts, man.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I like the trees.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: The trees are going to be bananas. knock at the door. Too engrossed in the TV, neither guy moves. Rachael pops her head in the door. She looks a Adam nervously as he puts on his hat, covering his bald h Adam does

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Hey -- I’m just here to pick up my things and then I’1l be out of your way. his best to play it cool.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I put all of your things in a box. It’s outside the door on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Walked right past it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Well then I guess I’1l be on my way. (then noticing) Are you smoking weed? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Since when do you smoke?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s medicinal.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (impressed) You got a prescription for medicinal marijuana?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: No, I got a prescription for medicinal marijuana, Adam was too afraid.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I have night blindness. Rods and cones are eschew, and weed fixes it. Rachael grins and rolls her eyes. She notices the new TV, which has replaced her painting on the wall. The painting sits stashed in the corner. Sadness sweeps across her fac

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (disappointed) You took my painting down.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It didn’t really fit there with the new TV.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Adam, can I talk to you outside for a second please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Rachael exit Adam’s house and sit on the porch stoop.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: So...how are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Pretty awesome. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (contrite) I’m sorry too, I know this wasn’t easy for you. And I’m sorry I didn’t come to your opening, it’s only because I hate you so much.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I’m glad you didn’t come. It was a complete disaster. No one bought any of my paintings.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smiles) Really?...But they’re...so...great.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’ll get it next time. She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to break up. I can be better. We can start over again. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: I‘ll just be better. He kisses back. After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You should go. She continues kissing him. He continues kissing back. He struggles to pull back, but does. He stares at her, shake his head-

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please...I need you to get the fuck off of my porch now. Rachael looks at Adam, pissed, hurt, ego shattered. She p up her belongings, turns and walks toward her car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam notices Rachael’s painting still on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your painting.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
