dialogues.text: I made it for you. Rachael continues to her car. A beat. Adam then gets up o the porch and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: Rachael’s Painting. Adam and Kyle are hammering it to a tree. From a box of various supplies, they pull out the following items and destroy the painting: kitchen knives, screw driver, garli press, a Molotov cocktail made out of hair-spray, eggs, orange juice, shaving cream, and an ax. Adam and Kyle look down at the destroyed painting.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It actually looks a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, we could hang this up. EXT. MITCH’S HOUSE - BACK PORCH - DAY Adam, Kyle, Mitch and Alan laugh hysterically as they smo joint.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to Alan) You were around before TV, right? Because I want to hear about the radio...They talk about people just sitting around and listening to the radio--

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Glued to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What did you listen to? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: “Little Orphan Annie”.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What did you look at when you were listening, nothing?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: It engaged everything.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m doing a radio piece on a volcano.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I do radio I think people will actually like. Mostly stuff about food...Like hamburger. People like listening to that versus “Coming up next, a volcano!”.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know what I’d do? I’d turn on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s not the same. Just then, an attractive fifty-something woman, BERNIE, carries out a tray of wheatgrass.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thank you, sweetheart. Bernie just blended up some wheatgrass. Beware, it’s like drinking liquid lawn cuttings. (beat) Oh, Bernie, this is Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hi. This is my friend Kyle. Kyle takes a sip of wheatgrass and nearly gags.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: (re: wheatgrass) You like it?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (in disgust) It’s not good. Bernie smiles, amused by Kyle, then turns back to Adam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: So, you're Adam? From the way Mitch described you I thought you were much older.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: He was eighty-five years old when he was three. Mitch looks at his wife adoringly and takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Come here. Mitch pulls her close her for a kiss. Adam looks at them, envious, a thin smile on his face. INT. KATHERINE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Adam walks in, flustered and annoyed as he talks to his m on the phone. He sits down -- wrapping up the conversatio

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Mom it’s not a virus!...No, it’s the screen saver. Adam mouths sorry to Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--Please, I’m telling you, just move the mouse...mom I can’t talk now. I have an appointment. Yes, right now. I’m standing inside the office as we speak...I don’t know what I’m making for dinner...something, I’1l figure it out. Adam looks at Katherine, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-Mom, I really have to go. OK, hanging up the phone now. OK, I know...Love you too. Adam hangs up the phone. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. I have parents too. Adam grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Do yours give you migraines?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: My parents are something I would talk about with my therapist.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we could role play. I can be your mom.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (repulsed) Oh God, no. That’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why is that disgusting? Adam sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: My mom is a crazy person who worries incessantly. Honestly, it annoys the shit out of me. And it’s not helpful...I can’t talk to her. Katherine thinks - connects the dots in her head.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So now she has a husband she can’t talk to, and a son who won’t talk to her. Adam’s taken aback by Katherine’s bluntness.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I mean, aren’t you being kind of a dick?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? Is that a medical term? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Your parents are who they are, you can’t change that. The only thing you can change is how you choose to deal with them.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Aren’t you supposed to subtly manipulate me into being aware of my faults? Not call me out.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I think we’re beyond that point. You did clean my car. Katherine looks at Adam with tenderness, grabs hold of hi shoulder, squeezing it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (frustrated) It’s weird, isn’t it? Shouldn’t have done it. Shouldn't have gone for it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, it was good, it was good.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No, it wasn’t. It’s so forced.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Here try again, I was too far. Come in a little closer. He inches closer to her, and sticks out his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m going to make it real natural. Katherine places a hand on him, testing.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That was better. They share a smile. After a beat Katherine looks down - s consciously. INT. HOSPITAL. CHEMOTHERAPY TREATMENT ROOM —- MORNING Adam sits down next to Alan, but notices there’s no Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You're all set. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Where’s Mitch?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (somber ) He died last night.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But we were just with him, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) What does it matter, his heart stopped. They can’t look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle’s car drives up the cemetery’s long driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed for a funeral, Adam and Kyle walk through the gro passing hundreds of tombstones along the way. Adam is mor Kyle is trying to cheer him up. EXT. MITCH’S FUNERAL - DAY Adam, Kyle and Alan stand next to a MINISTER as he speaks Bernie stands in front of them, trying to hold it togethe We PUSH IN on Adam, as the Minister’s voice recedes into background. INT. ADAM’S LIVING ROOM - DAY Adam lights a joint. He turns on the TV. Matlock appears his flat screen TV. Adam flips the channels. And finally the NEWS -- BREAKING NEWS: MT. MOHA MOHA ERUPTING. Adam watches the volcano erupt with bittersweet sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lies on the bed of an MRI machine. His body is slowl drawn into the scanner.  INT. HOSPITAL. KATHERINE’S OFFICE - DAY Adam lies on the couch staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: just beginning to realize that probably going to die.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Did something happen? Did you get the MRI results back?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, but look at me, I'm not getting any better. I look in the mirror and it’s pretty obvious. (beat) Mitch died, Alan's probably going to die, and so am I.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You don’t know that...A lot of what you're feeling is from the treatment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Look. Thank you, but you don’t need to try and cheer me up. I mean, in the end, what does it really matter anyway? We’re all going to die. You're just going to die, hopefully a lot later than I am. Not expecting this turn from Adam, Katherine’s demeanor stiffens - she looks anxious.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam, okay, what you’re going through - is something called “The Alienation Phase”...And I know that you’re feeling helpless inside, but you should know that this is totally normal for someone in your situation.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (annoyed) I’m sorry, but, I’m going to have to call you on that. It’s bullshit. That’s what everyone has been saying. “You’ll get better” and “It'll be fine”. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM (cont'd) I don’t know why everyone is so fucking scared to say it. “You’re dying, dude”...It makes it worse.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (speechless) Adam, I’m here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Why? So that when you’re at some dinner party in 30 years, you can tell some inspiring anecdote about you coached your third patient through the alienation phase, and helped him feel “normal” right before he died.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam...I...I’m sorry - if - I said the wrong things. I-

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: This isn’t working for me. Adam leaves. Katherine is overcome with a sense of failur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess. Adam dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not around. Leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey man, it’s Adam. I was wondering if you could give me a ride to my doctor's appointment today...It’s the big one. Adam hangs up and hesitates. After a beat, he dials again. Adam holds the phone away from his ear and cringes. A pan regret runs through his body.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh my God, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi Mom.  INT. DR ROSS’ OFFICE - DAY Diane, Adam and Richard are seated in the exam room. Dian and Adam nervously flip through magazines while Richard i lost somewhere in his own world. The tension is thick. Di looks at her watch and shivers. There’s a knock at the do A friendly looking Nurse enters.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY NURSE
dialogues.text: The doctor’s just in with another patient, but should be out in a few minutes. You guys holding up alright?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: It’s very cold in here. Is there anyway you can turn down the air conditioning?

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY NURSE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately the temperature is controlled by a central thermostat.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: My son has cancer.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY NURSE
dialogues.text: (feels bad) I'm sorry, really, if I could I would, but there’s nothing I can do. Adam's pissed that his mother has just involved him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smiles to the Nurse) Don’t worry about it. (Scowls at Diane) I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY NURSE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I could get you a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, really, I’m okay. But thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I'd love a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to the friendly Nurse) We're fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRIENDLY NURSE
dialogues.text: Okay, but you let me know if you need anything. The Nurse smiles and then exits.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (Re: the friendly Nurse) I don’t like her. Diane puts her hand on Adam’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You feel warm.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Diane gets up from her chair and paces around the room looking at the doctor’s various degrees on the wall. Adam looks on, annoyed at every step his mother takes. Diane closes in on one of the degrees and puts on her reading glasses for further examination.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (disapproving) Huh.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: It’s nothing, he went to a state college.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You’re unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I just worry that you’re not getting the best care possible. (beat) And I don’t think you’re eating right. Adam can’t take it anymore. He explodes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Will you stop! I’m not him. I can take care of myself. Diane is so frustrated, she’s near tears:

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: It’s so hard that you don’t let me help you. It’s really hard.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You are helping me. You brought me here, didn’t you? They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about you? She looks at him, baffled:

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (wiping her tears) How am I?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How are you? What’s going on in your life?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Seriously? Nothing is going on in my life. The highlight of my week is this cancer support group I’ve been going to.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You've been going to a support group?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: It’s for parents whose kids have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were doing that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: How would you? You never call me back. He looks at her. He softens.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to say you’re sorry. Adam takes her hand in his. She’s clearly moved. A beat. Ross storms into the room carrying a stack of MRI films. seems rushed.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you folks waiting. Adam and Diane look at Dr. Ross with blank stares.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway I'll cut to the chase. The cancer’s not responding to the chemo. Dr. Ross places the MRI into the light box. DR. ROSS (CONT’D) As you can see, the tumor is continuing to grow here, along the nerve. We have to remove it now or we risk metastasis. Adam and Diane squint to see what Ross is talking about, see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: We need to operate. Now, I was able to move some things around, and I can get you in this Thursday morning with Dr. Walderson. He’s one of our best neurosurgeons.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: But he’s going to be okay, right? You're going to fix it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Considering the placement and size of the tumor, a surgery of this nature is very dangerous, and potentially life threatening itself. The surgeons will be very aggressive in their attempt. But if we're unsuccessful in removing the cancer...then unfortunately we’re out of options. Diane takes hold of Adam’s hand. They sit silently as the doctor’s words soak in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sitting in the park over looking the city. Kyle is d - Adam is still nursing his first beer.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to bring up the fact that your surgery is tomorrow. Not even thinking about it. So don’t worry about it, cause I’m not going to bring it up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You remember the last time we came out here?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It was prom night.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That memory is so far from me...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago, I don’t even remember who you went with.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (bitter) Nora Mattingly.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. That girl sucked. You really know how to pick ‘em. Even then I think you knew.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She seemed so sweet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: She was never sweet. She always sucked.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You just always hate my girlfriends

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s not true... OK it is, actually. But it’s because you date fucking dickheads. Needy bitches. Whhhhyyyyyy? Adam looks like he’s on the verge of falling apart. Kyle his arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s fucking cold. And it’s only midnight! Dude, let’s go to a bar, try to get laid.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Don’t you ever give up?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: C'mon! I had fun with that! Kyle points at Adam’s head as he stands, then stumbles. H drunk.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I know you had fun.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You could too, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It worked! Take your hat off!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I think I should drive.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I would let you drive but you don’t know how. You don’t have a license.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (somber ) This might be my last chance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Driving! That’s what you want to do? That’s your “Make A Wish”? To drive? We could be having sex with hookers while skydiving, and instead you want to do something I learned to do when I was fifteen! (concedes ) Fine, but be careful. Kyle hands Adam his keys.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drive carefully. And don’t adjust my seat settings. The two climb into Kyle’s car. Adam puts the key in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (condescendingly) Now, first thing you want to do-- Without checking the mirrors, he backs the car up. BOOM t car SLAMS into a BIKE RACK.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck! Adam pulls out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make a left. Make a left! It’s a one way street! Adam turns left onto a one way street. It’s the wrong way

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck? There’s a car! Wrong way! Wrong way! Wrong way! What the hell! An oncoming car honks and swerves out of the way - only nearly avoiding a head on collision.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Adam! Stop man - stop! Kyle pulls the emergency brake. The car stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing, man? You’re being an idiot right now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Get out. Get out of the car. Kyle stammers as Adam looks like he’s about to erupt.

dialogues.speaker: GET
dialogues.text: Adam starts hitting Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Kyle looks at Adam speechless, and then gets out of the c Adam locks the doors and sits quietly for a moment. He th proceeds to scream at the top of his lungs. Twenty seven years worth of suppressed emotions come out. Adam then si in total silence. After a beat, he pulls out his cell pho Kyle notices. He tries to open the door. It’s locked. Ada ignores Kyle and begins to dial.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare call her! Not after everything she’s done to you...You’re a pussy, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're a selfish piece of shit who cares more about getting fucking laid than being my friend. Kyle looks hurt. Adam holds the phone up to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. It’s not Rachael...it’s Katherine. She’s sitting on her bed, reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Hey, it’s Adam.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam? She looks at the clock, it’s midnight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s midnight. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (still nonchalant) Oh, just having a nervous breakdown. I think I fractured my larynx.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m really, really glad you called. There’s a long silence. Tears roll down Adam’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I want this to be over. I’m so fucking tired of being sick...if this surgery doesn’t work, that’s it -- (crying) I’ve never been to fucking Canada or told a girl I love her...it sounds stupid.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No. It doesn’t. Katherine’s eyes begin to well. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) I’m sorry I was such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I was the asshole. I was so totally unprepared - for you. This job is really hard. If I fuck up, I could ruin someone’s whole life.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I guess we’re both beginners at this.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What were you doing when I called? Were you on Facebook? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (laughs ) You know, stalking my ex-boyfriend isn’t the only thing I do in my free time. A beat. Adam sighs:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I wish you were my girlfriend. She takes this in, kind of wishing it too. Silence as

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Girlfriends can be nice. You just had a bad one.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I bet you’d be a good one. Katherine blushes. Then: There’s a loud knock on the window. It’s Kyle. He’s freezing. Adam hangs

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Let me in man, Jesus. It’s fucking freezing!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m going to go. Thanks...Thanks for everything.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Good night. up the phone. Kyle bangs on the car window desperately. Adam finally unlocks the car. EXT. KYLE’S APARTMENT - LATER THAT NIGHT Kyle and Adam enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too drunk to stand, Kyle uses Adam as a crutch to support himself as looks like quiet. The Kyle keels bathroom. they enter his apartment, which is a mess - it it hasn’t been cleaned in years. Kyle is unusually mood is solemn - these guys never fight. over to pass out on the couch. Adam walks into the  INT. KYLE'S BATHROOM —- CONTINUOUS With his finger, Adam scoops some dust up off the counter Grossed out, he looks around for a towel to wipe the dust his hand. No towels. He wipes it off on his jeans. He the notices something on the ground, in front of the toilet. book. He leans over and picks up “Coping with Your Loved One's Cancer”. The book is worn and has multiple book mar indicating it’s been read. Adam looks out at Kyle, he had pegged all wrong. Adam then turns and looks at himself in mirror. He takes a deep breath. A beat. He claps his hand the lights turn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 3 a.m. The streets are completely vacant of life. Ad walks along this normally busy avenue all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks along the sidewalk of his street and turns up front walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam packs a small DUFFEL BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam kneels down, pours some dog food into a bowl for Skeletor. He looks at the dog, who looks back, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Come here, boy. Skeletor begins to eat. Adam looks in Skeletor’s eyes and gives him one last pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam steps out onto the porch carrying his duffle bag. As walks down the steps, he looks back at his house, takes a deep breath, and leaves. I/E. KYLE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER Adam gets into Kyle’s car. The mood is eerie and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Adam sit silently parked in front of the hospita

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (beat) You ready?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: It’s going to be good. It’s going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. We hear a voice from across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: That’s your mom. Adam rolls down the window. Sure enough, his mom is from across the parking lot- DIANE’S VOICE Adam!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: So I'll park the car I guess, and then come inside--

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: --and I'll see you before you go in there?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Um...I’m not sure how it works.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Then I’1l see you after...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yep. yelling Kyle looks at him unsure what to say. Adam leans across a hugs Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: So I'll see you in there... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Thanks. Adam steps out of the car and walks across the vast concr expanse toward his mother and father who stand waiting fo him. INT. HOSPITAL PRE-OP ROOM —- EARLY MORNING Adam lies on a gurney. His parents stand beside him. DR. WALDERSON the neurosurgeon enters.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WALDERSON
dialogues.text: Good morning, I’m Dr. Walderson, I‘ll be performing your surgery today...How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WALDERSON
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Good. Good. Dr. Walderson looks over her chart.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WALDERSON
dialogues.text: So we’re going to take excellent care of you. Our surgical team is top-notch. You just try to relax. Adam’s completely terrified. Dr. Walderson exits. Nurse Stewart hands Adam a giant pile of disclaimers to sign.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What is all this?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE STEWART
dialogues.text: Standard paperwork: hospital liability and disclaimer forms and organ donor authorization. Richard whispers closely into Adam’s ear:

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I got a new coat... Brooks Brothers. Silk Pockets. Feel. Adam sticks his hand inside the pocket of Richard’s coat.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Feel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I am feeling. Adam looks up at his dad, standing there in his confused state:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dad, listen. I know it’s probably hard to follow what’s going on right now -- but I want you to know that I love you very much. Richard looks at his son, blank expression on his face:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: OK, Dad. Adam smiles at his father, and then looks at his mother. LEE enters-—

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: Hello Adam, I’m Dr. Lee -- I’m here to administer your anesthesia.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: Now relax, I’m going to inject the anesthesia through your IV... It’s going to take a few moments before you begin to feel the effects...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're doing it now?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE STEWART
dialogues.text: (to Diane and Richard) If you guys could just head over to the waiting room that'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How long will it last?

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: That really depends on the individual-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well, how do you know if it’s going to last long enough so I won’t wake up in the middle of surgery? Or what if I don’t wake up after? Mom?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Sweetie you’re going to be just fine. He leans over the bed into his mother’s arms. She holds h for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry but we’ve got to get Adam to the operating room.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you just wait a moment, please? Dr. Lee unlocks Adam’s gurney.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LEE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Diane kisses Adam on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I love you, Adam. Dr. Lee nods to a couple nurses, who pull Adam’s gurney through double doors. He disappears into fluorescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam’s gurney is PULLED INTO frame. We push in on Adam’s unconscious face. Now, several ARMS reach out and grab hi placing him on the operating table. SFX: The rhythmic beep of his heart monitor. The echoing sound of his breath. It initiates a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Katherine sits in her office, talking to a patient. She nods, jots notes, but her head is somewhere else. --Diane and Richard sit in the waiting room. She holds a handful of pills. Richard takes them from her. She looks his eyes, terrified. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- IN A WIDE SHOT, we see the operating table. Two neurosurgeons, Dr. Walderson and DR. PHILLIPS are in mid- surgery. Alongside the two doctors are TWO NURSES. -- Kyle stands outside the hospital’s front entrance. Nex him, a couple of NURSES on a smoke break talk animatedly. stares ahead, nervous. -- The operating room is empty. Adam lies on the surgical table, now face up with an oxygen mask over his mouth. Hi eyes are closed and his complexion is cold and pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, Richard and Kyle sit together, anxious. Katherine enters the room and sits across from the others. They exchange awkward looks.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (to Kyle) It’s been five hours. Kyle looks over clearly very aware of that fact:

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Has it?

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Something’s wrong. We should have heard by now.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. Adam’s going to be fine, okay? Katherine hears Adam’s name. She leans over to Kyle, Rich and Diane.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Adam Lerner?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (startled) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dr. Walderson is one of the best surgeons in the country, so he’s in good hands.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Who are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I...uh, I’m Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: The therapist! I’m Kyle, Adam’s friend.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: These are Adam’s parents.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s nice to meet you. She smiles and nods awkwardly. Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Did he say I was a dick? ‘Cause I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I want you to know, I smothered him because I love him. Katherine smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Seriously, did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I...I can’t...I wouldn’t...1I wouldn’t talk about that sort of thing. Kyle and Diane turn their attention away from Katherine, dejected. In the distance, they spot Dr. Walderson. Every jumps up as she approaches:

dialogues.speaker: DR. WALDERSON
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Lerner. So as you can imagine, with a surgery of this magnitude...there were some unforeseen complications. The bone erosion was much greater than initially anticipated. We had to remove part of the hip and pelvis, as well as most of the right psoas muscle. We also had to remove a good amount of sheath tissue around the sciatic nerve. It’s not going to be an easy road back, but he’s going to be okay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (relieved) He’s going to be okay? Dr. Walderson nods.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: You should start with that information. That should be the first thing you say. He turns to hug Diane:

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's OK! Diane and Kyle hug, then pull Richard into the hug.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Walderson) Thank you, doctor, thank you! Diane and Kyle start crying. Katherine sees this tender moment and shies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam’s in his hospital bed - still asleep from the surger Richard and Diane enter the room. Adam reacts like a litt kid being picked up from pre-school.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mommy !

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: (crying) My little boy.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s nice here. I got a good room.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We need to go on more vacations.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Yes, we’ll go on a huge vacation! We can go to Hawaii! Kyle awkwardly stands over Adam, trying to act normal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Hey man? What’s up?...I’m afraid to touch you, but um-- Adam sticks out his pinkie which Kyle gently fist bumps.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Boom. You look really good.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'm high as a motherfucka. Kyle looks at Diane with a guilty expression.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Um...we don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lies in bed. His eyes open, staring at the ceiling. quiet. Peaceful. Katherine knocks on the door and walks i Adam speaks; woozy from the morphine, and very weak:

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s you.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It is me. She stands next to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Grrreat. I love morphine...What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s eight o’clock. I was just working late, so I thought I'd stop by.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (wide smile) Working late - you got a new patient?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I got a few new patients, actually.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam smiles. Looks into her eyes for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I'd like to make you pancakes some time.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's very nice, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (dead serious) You’re going to like them. Katherine laughs. She sits next to him on the bed, and ta hold of his hand. Unlike her previous attempts, this time grip is perfect. Adam notices.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m peeing right now.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to look. We stay on Adam and Katherine looking into each other’s e as Katherine moves her hand down his arm, finally claspin his hand in hers. I/E. ADAM’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Kyle, staring at the wound with trepidation, absolutely disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Ugh, it’s gross! Oh God - I keep looking back at it thinking it’s going to be less gross. The wound is revealed to be on Adam's back. Adam -- hair slowly beginning to grow back, looking much healthier, relaxed -- looks back at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can we just get it over with? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Your mom does this?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She does it all the time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This is like some “Saw” shit.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (unaffected) Your words are so comforting.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’m just gonna do it, I’m gonna act like it’s nothing. Kyle puts a gob of antibiotic ointment on his finger and tentatively reaches towards Adam’s back.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m going to be really proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Ugh! I’m doing it. I’m inside you! Adam looks over his shoulder, notices Kyle applying the ointment.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait, is that your finger?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Is that your finger?

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (guilty) No.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: There's Q-Tips!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Kyle quickly applies some ointment on a Q-TIP.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That was your finger, wasn’t it!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Would it be bad if it was?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Did you wash your hands? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I used a Q-Tip the whole time, don't worry about it. Kyle swabs the wound with the Q-Tip.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: This looks like Kuato from “Total Recall”. Adam grabs his back to imitate Kuato.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: The oxygen!

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (disgusted) No! Don’t do that! Ugh! Kyle feebly applies the DRESSING on Adam’s wound.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can we get this going? It’s seven thirty. Come on, put on the bandage. Kyle gingerly applies the bandage whilst turning his head Wound now covered, Kyle looks self-assured -- it’s a pret shoddy job.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: And you, are ready for your date! Adam gingerly stands and buttons up his shirt. He walks o and looks in the mirror. He rubs his short hair in contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s crazy. I look pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: I’d fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks. The DOORBELL rings. Adam looks at Kyle, a bit nervous.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (excited) Who could that be? Go answer it, go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam takes a deep breath and opens the front door. He lig up when he sees KATHERINE standing in front of him. She's holding a PIZZA.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thanks. (awkward beat) You too. You look super nice.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smiles) You want to come in?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah. They walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Look at you, walking up a storm. Kyle clears his throat and waves meekly from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You remember Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Good to see you...I see you brought a pizza, which is good because I haven't fed him all day. I just changed the dressing on his wound. There’s Vicodin in the bathroom if you need it; I know people take it recreationally but he actually needs it for his aches-- Adam stares at Kyle, blankly. Katherine looks to Adam, un how to react.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (dead serious) Are there channels he can’t watch? Katherine cracks a smile. Kyle beams. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: (to Adam) That’s funny. (to Katherine) So, you're doing your doctorate I hear? That’s-- Adam opens the door and ushers Kyle out.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Dude, you’re awesome.

dialogues.speaker: KYLE
dialogues.text: Alright! Kyle moves toward the door and whispers to Adam-

dialogues.speaker: KYLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s cool. Adam smiles, and closes the door on Kyle. Adam then turns around and looks at Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Now what? A beat as Adam thinks, then flashes a smile. MUSIC SWELLS as we go...
